etymologies: 1970s: perhaps from the name of the Turkish capital Ankara

definitions: a type of cotton cloth featuring brightly colored patterns produced by means of a wax-resist dye technique, associated especially with West African fashion

examples.text: we've seen the classic ankara adorned with different accessories
some of the outfits she has worn feature traditional ankara prints

shortDefinitions: cotton cloth that has been dyed using wax-resist technique
